info.title: Deletion information
info.text1: The deletion is a two step process:
info.text1-1: First you mark the items for deletion. This operation will mark all the sub items, including pages, for deletion.
info.text1-1-1: At this stage, it is still possible to undo the operation, and undelete the items, so they are not marked for deletion anymore.
info.text1-2: Then you proceed to the actual deletion:
info.text1-2-1: If the items were previously published, you will need to “Publish the deletion”, so that the items are deleted in both live and edit.
info.text1-2-2: If the items were not previously published, the option is then “Delete permanently”.
info.text1-2-3: These operations cannot be undone, and the deleted items cannot be recovered.
info.text2: The second step of the process (the actual deletion), and the undeletion, need to be performed on the item that was first marked for deletion. You cannot mark a page for deletion, and then permanently delete a single item of the page. In such a case, you need to undelete the page, and then proceed to the full deletion of the content item before marking the page for deletion again.
info.text3: It is possible to see if the items marked for deletion are referenced by other contents (e.g. a link might exist to a page marked for deletion). In such cases, it is advised to update the references. Not doing so can create broken links/references.

mark.title: Mark for deletion
mark.items: You are about to delete {{count}} items, including {{pages}} page(s)
mark.filesAndFolders: You are about to delete {{count}} items, including {{folders}} folder(s)
mark.itemsOnly: You are about to delete {{count}} items

permanently.title: Delete permanently
permanently.item: You are about to permanently delete {{name}}. This operation cannot be undone.
permanently.items: You are about to permanently delete {{count}} items, including {{pages}} page(s). This operation cannot be undone.
permanently.filesAndFolders: You are about to permanently delete {{count}} items, including {{folders}} folder(s). This operation cannot be undone.
permanently.itemsOnly: You are about to permanently delete {{count}} items. This operation cannot be undone.

undelete.title: Undelete
undelete.item: Do you really want to undelete {{name}} ?
undelete.items: Do you really want to undelete {{count}} items, including {{pages}} page(s) ?
undelete.filesAndFolders: Do you really want to undelete {{count}} items, including {{folders}} folder(s) ?
undelete.itemsOnly: Do you really want to undelete {{count}} items ?

hasUsages.single: This item is currently referenced by other items. Deleting it will create broken references.
hasUsages.some: Some of these items are currently referenced by other items. Deleting them will create broken references.
hasUsages.tooMany: The system could not verify if the items to be deleted are currently referenced by other items (too many items to verify). You can manually verify the usages of all items in the table below.

permanently.title: Cannot be deleted
permanently.content: The content item {{name}} cannot currently be deleted on its own. Please undelete, or permanently delete, its parent content {{parentName}} which was the one initially marked for deletion.
permanently.content_plural: {{count}} items {{name}} cannot currently be deleted on their own. Please undelete, or permanently delete, their parent content {{parentName}} which was the one initially marked for deletion.

undelete.title: Cannot be undeleted
undelete.content: The content item {{name}} cannot currently be undeleted on its own. Please undelete its parent content {{parentName}} which was the one initially marked for deletion.
undelete.content_plural: {{count}} items {{name}} cannot currently be undeleted on their own. Please undelete their parent content {{parentName}} which was the one initially marked for deletion.
